event.title: was originally established as a community in 1911

data.event: Montgomery was originally established as a community in 1911.

In 1943, it was renamed to Montgomery, named after Field Marshal Bernard Law Montgomery, 1st Viscount Montgomery of Alamein, a celebrated British military leader who played an important role in WWI and WWII.
On December 24, 1957, Montgomery incorporated as a town, but changed to village status less than four months later on April 15, 1958.

event.title: changed to village status less than four months later

data.event: On December 24, 1957, Montgomery incorporated as a town, but changed to village status less than four months later on April 15, 1958.

event.title: was eventually absorbed by the City of Calgary on August 15, 1963

data.event: The village was eventually absorbed by the City of Calgary on August 15, 1963 via amalgamation.
